page.title: 04Pick Your Own
page.content: First you go in the car or you walk to the{strawberry field}.A man weighs your basket(s) and containers, writes the basket's weight on to it so that you don't pay for the weight of the basket. You take your own containers or can buy a cardboard basket from the grower. The whole field is full of{strawberry plants} and you are free to pick as much as you like. People usually eat some while they are picking. To pick a{strawberry}you have to push around the bush and pick a red one. It's important to pick a red one because if you pick a white one it isn't ripe. When you think you have got enough, you go to the man to get the{strawberries}weighed and paid for. The first week in July they cost 45p a pound.
